page.title: 16LIFE ON TRELIVER FARM
page.content: Every day my dad gets up at four o'clock to milk the cows.We have a herd of 278 cows.My dad comes in at 8 o'clock for his breakfast.After that he scrapes out the yard of muck. On our farm we have two 270 acres . That land is mostly grass.Every year we have silage and straw. Silage is grass chopped up. Straw is the waste prouct of corn. At twelve o'clock my Dad goes in for his dinner.He carries out any necessary jobs in the afternoon.At the moment he is working on a silage pit. It has to be cemented. At three o'clock he starts the afternoon milking. It takes him until 8 o'clock at night to finish.It takes six hours to do a whole days milking. My dad would like to give up farming because of days like this.
